findings.title: Inconsistent Fee Rate Used in DaoSwap
findings.description: The `DAOLibrary` contract uses inconsistent fee rates in the `getAmountIn()` and `getAmountOut()` interfaces compared to the `swap()` function, which may cause users to not receive the expected amount of assets.

findings.title: Improved Sanity Checks For System Parameters
findings.description: The `SatoshiIncognito DaoSwap` protocol lacks proper sanity checks for the available `DAO` token in the contract which may lead to the trading being reverted.

findings.title: Incompatibility with Deflationary Tokens
findings.description: The contract's asset-transferring routines do not work correctly with deflationary tokens, which can cause inconsistent internal asset balances and actual token balances.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the DaoSwap protocol, there is a privileged account, i.e., owner, that plays a critical role in governing and regulating the system-wide operations.

findings.title: Potential Arbitrage Swaps To Drain All Rewards
findings.description: Malicious traders may trigger repeated swaps to drain all available rewards once they are added by the owner, as the mining reward is bigger than the swap fee rate.

findings.title: Proper Management For The Invitation Rewards
findings.description: The `SatoshiIncognito DaoSwap` protocol does not properly manage invitation rewards, which may lead to users failing to unstake their DAO tokens from the contract.
